a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Expected share of deaths from non-communicable diseases, by gender,
The estimated share of 30-year-olds who would die before their 70th birthday from common non-communicable diseases: any of
cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes, or chronic respiratory disease.
Note: Estimates assume that current mortality rates continue and they would not have already died from any other cause of death (e.g., injuries or
